phase_goal: Establish core mental models and fundamental principles of negotiation.
rationale: This phase focuses on building a solid understanding of human psychology and basic negotiation concepts. Understanding these concepts will help students approach negotiation with a new perspective.
concepts: Tactical Empathy / Active Listening / Forced Empathy / Understanding the Other Party's Perspective
No Deal is Better Than a Bad Deal

phase_goal: Introduce actionable techniques and practical 'how-to' concepts for effective negotiation.
rationale: This phase builds upon the foundational knowledge by teaching specific techniques that can be immediately applied in negotiation scenarios. It focuses on the practical aspects of influencing and persuading others.
concepts: Labeling / Neutralize the Negative, Reinforce the Positive / Summary (Paraphrasing + Labeling)

phase_goal: Explore advanced negotiation nuances, strategic thinking, and handling complex situations.
rationale: This phase delves into the subtleties of negotiation, focusing on strategic decision-making, understanding the broader context, and adapting to challenging scenarios. It explores edge cases and philosophical considerations to elevate the student's negotiation skills to an expert level.
concepts: Team Behind the Counterpart / Level II Players
Guarantee Execution / Ensuring Commitment and Discovering Hidden Information
Decision Architect / Strategic Communication and Influence
